citadels

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • citadels.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Each player has a name, gold, hand of district cards, built districts, and a character.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a new Player with the given name and initializes gold to 2, and empty lists for hand and built districts.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGold(int amount)
      Adds the specified amount of gold to the player's total.
      void assignCharacter(CharacterCard character)
      Assigns a character to the player for the current round and resets assassination status.
      void buildDistrict(DistrictCard newCard)
      Builds a district from the player's hand if they can afford it.
      void drawCard(DistrictCard newCard)
      Adds a district card to the player's hand.
      java.util.List<DistrictCard> getBuiltDistricts()
      Returns the list of districts the player has built.
      CharacterCard getCharacter()
      Returns the character assigned to the player for the current round.
      int getGold()
      Returns the amount of gold the player currently has.
      java.util.List<DistrictCard> getHand()
      Returns the player's current hand of district cards.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the player.
      boolean hasBuilt(java.lang.String name)
      Checks whether the player has built a district with the given name.
      boolean isAssassinated()
      Returns whether the player has been assassinated this round.
      boolean receiveCrown()
      Returns whether this player currently holds the crown.
      void setAssassinated(boolean assassinated)
      Sets whether the player has been assassinated this round.
      void setReceiveCrown(boolean crown)
      Sets whether this player receives the crown.
      boolean spendGold(int amount)
      pts to spend the specified amount of gold.

        Constructs a new Player with the given name and initializes gold to 2, and empty lists for hand and built districts.

    • Method Detail

      • addGold

        public void addGold(int amount)
        Adds the specified amount of gold to the player's total.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of gold to add

      • spendGold

        public boolean spendGold(int amount)
        pts to spend the specified amount of gold.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of gold to spend
        Returns:
        true if the player had enough gold and the amount was spent, false otherwise

      • drawCard

        public void drawCard(DistrictCard newCard)
        Adds a district card to the player's hand.
        Parameters:
        newCard - the district card to add

      • buildDistrict

        public void buildDistrict(DistrictCard newCard)
        Builds a district from the player's hand if they can afford it. The card is removed from the hand and added to built districts.
        Parameters:
        newCard - the district card to build

      • hasBuilt

        public boolean hasBuilt(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether the player has built a district with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the district to check
        Returns:
        true if the district has been built; false otherwise

      • assignCharacter

        public void assignCharacter(CharacterCard character)
        Assigns a character to the player for the current round and resets assassination status.
        Parameters:
        character - the character card to assign

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the player.
        Returns:
        the player's name

      • getGold

        public int getGold()
        Returns the amount of gold the player currently has.
        Returns:
        the player's gold amount

      • getHand

        public java.util.List<DistrictCard> getHand()
        Returns the player's current hand of district cards.
        Returns:
        the list of district cards in hand

      • getBuiltDistricts

        public java.util.List<DistrictCard> getBuiltDistricts()
        Returns the list of districts the player has built.
        Returns:
        the list of built district cards

      • getCharacter

        public CharacterCard getCharacter()
        Returns the character assigned to the player for the current round.
        Returns:
        the player's character card

      • setReceiveCrown

        public void setReceiveCrown(boolean crown)
        Sets whether this player receives the crown.
        Parameters:
        crown - true if the player receives the crown, false otherwise

      • receiveCrown

        public boolean receiveCrown()
        Returns whether this player currently holds the crown.
        Returns:
        true if the player has the crown, false otherwise

      • setAssassinated

        public void setAssassinated(boolean assassinated)
        Sets whether the player has been assassinated this round.
        Parameters:
        assassinated - true if the player is assassinated, false otherwise

      • isAssassinated

        public boolean isAssassinated()
        Returns whether the player has been assassinated this round.
        Returns:
        true if the player is assassinated, false otherwise
